value.title: DAX Fridays! #77: GROUPBY, CURRENTGROUP
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays, we will go through the DAX function GROUPBY with an example.  GROUPBY is similar as SUMMARIZE, but the difference is that in the expression part, you use DAX iterators to get your results. You can also nest GROUPBY functions to get for example the highest sales amount by country.

value.title: DAX Fridays! #78: When should I use FILTER() with CALCULATE?
value.excerpt: When should you use the filter function with CALCULATE?  As you probably have noticed, sometimes people use a column in the filter part of CALCULATE and sometimes they use the FILTER function.  The question is, when should you use what? value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IPziqmQgJFw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Document a Power BI file and report in a few clicks   all DAX code visualization Power Query scripts
value.excerpt: In this article and video, I’ll share with you how to document everything from a Power BI file in a few clicks. The document output will have all the DAX code (measures, columns, and tables) with the expressions, the tables with the Power Query scripts, information about visualization such as how many

value.title: FILTER Function in DAX and Power BI   Apply Custom Filter to Calculations
value.excerpt: You can apply filtering to visualization elements. However, sometimes filtering has to be done on specific calculations. This can come in handy especially when you want to compare values of other items with specific items. In this article and video, I’ll explain how to use the FILTER function in DAX

value.title: Get a field value from a related table in Power BI DAX RELATED Function Explained
value.excerpt: Sometimes, in Power BI, you need to access a field’s value from another table that somehow is related to the existing table. You can use Power Query transformations such as combining Merge with something else. However, this can be needed when you write a DAX expression too. In this article and video,

value.title: Showing Ranking in a Visual in Power BI using RANKX DAX function
value.excerpt: If you want to show the ranking in a Power BI visual, one way is to use a visual that supports that, such as a Ribbon chart. Another way, which is a more common way, is to write a calculation for rank, and RANKX is a DAX function that can help you with that. In this article and video, I explain how that

value.title: Write Conditional Statement Using SWITCH in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: Conditional expressions are one of the most commonly used expressions in any language as well as DAX.
